prompt: <description>**Part 1** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees, and the translation vector to [0.0033, 0.3958, 0.0]. This will position and orient the prism in 3D space. Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle by defining the following lines: 1. line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.6993, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Start Point [0.6993, 0.0], End Point [0.3188, 0.5576] 3. line\\_3: Start Point [0.3188, 0.5576], End Point [0.0, 0.5576] 4. line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5576], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.6993 to adjust its size. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the coordinate system parameters. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.3958 units in the positive direction of the Z-axis to create the 3D model. **Part 2** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.08 units in height. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees, and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.3958, 0.0034]. This will position and orient the prism in 3D space. Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle by defining the following lines: 1. line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.6301], End Point [0.0019, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Start Point [0.0019, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] 3. line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.3293, 0.6301] 4. line\\_4: Start Point [0.3293, 0.6301], End Point [0.0, 0.6301] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 to adjust its size. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the coordinate system parameters. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0792 units in the positive direction of the Z-axis to create the 3D model. Combine this new prism with the previous one to join the models together. The final shape should be the combined rectangular prism with the specified dimensions, orientations, and positions.</description>
